title: Speed interval check mailbox
question_content: Good afternoon, dear friends. Thanks for the awesome program for the android version, I use it on my computer too. Can you tell me how to set the frequency of checking emails more often than the 15-minute interval? In other android mail clients, emails arrive almost immediately, within 5-10 seconds, but here the verification interval is very long, and manual verification is such a thing. How do I set it up?

title: Not receiving mail on Android smartphone after configuring using the barcode from Thunderbird desktop.
question_content:
Ich nutze Thunderbird auf dem PC ohne Probleme mit fünf Mailadressen. Jetzt habe ich die App Version auf mein Android Smartphone geladen mit dem Barcodescanner. Ich kann eMails versenden aber ich empfange auf keiner der Mailadressen eine Nachricht über die App Version. Auf der PC Version kommen die Nachrichten an.

Translation:
I use Thunderbird on my PC with five email addresses without any problems. I've now downloaded the app version to my Android smartphone with the barcode scanner. I can send emails, but I'm not receiving any messages from the app version at any of the email addresses. Messages arrive on the PC version.

title: sending email from a mobile device but the email will be filtered , bypassed ....
question_content:
Hi ,

     Recently I came across this issue . When I send a email out from my mobile device thru Thunderbird  , I track the message and discovered that it was filtered . The Delivered To : /dev/null , Router : fightSpamHG , Transport : **bypassed** . And the message was not delivered to the indented recipients . But if I use a desktop PC and send out email via Outlook , it is perfectly received . Can I ask the community if anyone came across this issue and if there is any solutions ? Thank you !

title: Bluemail & Thunderbird -- Android
question_content:
Hello! I am using the latest version of Thunderbird for an Android phone. I use Bluemail for my website. Here is the issue:

* Installation of the Thunderbird client is good.
* Establishing a connection to my Bluemail email account is good.
* IMAP works great.
* The issue is email can be sent, BUT the email does not reach the recipient. There are no errors in the Thunderbird app at all. Mail does not get delivered. I have tried several external recipient email accounts.

Now, the desktop app works great! So, the settings are the same.

Any thoughts?

Thank you.

title: Thunderbird for android and Google Advanced Protection Program
question_content:
I have recently been using thunderbird as my primary email client across my windows PC and android phone. I have been loving the experience so far, but I have noticed one issue for the android client. 

The thunderbird application for windows has no problem linking to my gmail account that is enrolled in the Google Advanced Protection Program, but the android app cannot make the connection as it is an unrecognised app. The error code I get is "Error 400: policy_enforced" 

I was wondering if there was any way to resolve this without getting rid of the advanced protection program?

title: Outlook error message
question_content:
Hello, when I try to login to my outlook.cz mail account, I get error screen that says: ''Server error
The server returned the following message: User is authenticated but not connected.'' I searched online and I found, that I wasn't the only one getting this error. Everyone solved it by disabling ipv6 in thunderbird. I don't know how to do that on phone (I found how to disable it on pc). I have another outlook.cz account that I am logged into and it works fine (I logged in 2 weeks ago). Is it thunderbird problem or should I contact microsoft. Thank you in advance for your answers.

title: Names folders
question_content:
Hello,

I am using french version of thunderbird for Android.

On my Gmail account, the word "[GMAIL]" appears before some names folders ("brouillon", "corbeille", "spam" and "tous les messages"). 
Also, on Gmail but also other clients like Hotmail, all created folders have the word "INBOX" before there name.

Is there a fix to this situation ?

Thank you for your time.

title: Forward emails permanently using Android App
question_content:
Dear Community

i use the Thunderbird app for Android (Samsung S23+ Android 14, OneUI 6.1) to retrieve emails from a mailbox (IMAP). That works. Now I would like to automatically forward incoming emails to other email addresses according to filter criteria.

I have filters for this in the desktop version. But I can't find them in the app. And the filter on the PC only works when the PC is running. Which it shouldn't. The forwarding should be done in the Android app. There is no access to a webmailer.

Many thanks for your help and happy easter,
Michael

title: Thunderbird Android App Doesn't Sync
question_content:
I have the Android T-bird app on my Google Pixel 9.

I am having constant problems with it not syncing. 

This morning, when I swiped down, the kept spinning but did not connect.
When i tapped the sync icon at the bottom left of the screen, nothing!

Nothing changed after rebooting the phone, which BTW takes almost twice as long as the reboot on my previous Samsung phones. 

I have now uninstalled and reinstalled, and imported my settings using the QR code on my desktop. It imported my accounts, but asked me to sign in or sign in later. There is no link for signing in immediately, and sign in later does not allow any sign in opportunity.

I now have no emails imported to the app.

Any help would be appreciated
